text:
- Take a look at
this scene yesterday.

I mean, you're familiar with it.
- Can I turn this way?

- Yeah, you can just look
at one of the screens.

OK, so this is the scene
yesterday in the Rose Garden.
- That was a great scene.

- But you have to
admit, Congressman,

that this is highly
unusual for a bill that
has not passed both chambers.

Isn't this like
celebrating at halftime?

- Yeah, that's why you
go into the huddle.

You go in there to celebrate
the things you did well.
- But this is not normal.

- Well, it's a
different presidency.

But I think this is the kind
of thing we need to do more

of because the Senate
is going to look at this

and they're saying,
you know what,

these guys are serious about
getting this over there.

They're going to see the support
with that many Congressmen

at the Rose Garden,
spur of the moment,

to come show the
President that we're
supporting what he's doing.

Now it's time for
the Senate to act.

And I think you're going to
see a different Senate dynamic.

- But couldn't the Senate
just leave you high and dry

and make you look silly being
there in the Rose Garden.

- Yeah, of course
they could, but who
are they leaving high and dry?
Us?

Are they leaving the
American people high and dry?
